column4: i got an error when booting from my USB from bios.  It reads: Com 32R Image error 8001
can anyone help me with my Error 8001. COM 32R Image error?
If you were to give us some context of what's giving you that error.
Maybe.
Produces a hash based on the data of a file. It can be used to verify the integrity of a file; a file with different contents will have a different hash (almost all of the time)
It won't "show you have a problem". The hash'll be different from what it should be if the ISO you have is incomplete or corrupt.
edbian: Would depend on the size of the file
the ubuntu user should already exist on a LiveCD.
So what should I do?
When you switch to a TTY it should prompt you for a login, right? It'll say "<hostname> login:"
how do i go to TTY?
Ctrl+Alt+F1
please guide me step by step? what do i do after ctrl alt f1?
It prompts you for a login, correct? What exactly is the problem you're attempting to solve, by the way?
i'm trying to get pass the black screen
Just a black screen with no prompt whatsoever? Just when it boots up, correct?
that's right
And you haven't tried the alternate CD like someone suggested above?
i d/l the alternate CD.ISO and md5sum check it and checks is fine
Is that what you're on now.
You could look up your netbook on Ubuntu's certified hardware list
interface wise, any difference from 11.04?
